issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: YARN-1707 added dynamic queues (ReservationQueue) to CapacityScheduler. The QueueCapacities data structure was added subsequently but is not being updated correctly for ReservationQueue. This JIRA tracks the changes required to update QueueCapacities of ReservationQueue correctly.
fields.summary: [Regression] QueueCapacities not being updated for dynamic ReservationQueue

comments.body: YARN-5435.v1.patch makes ReservationQueues inherit queueCapacities from its parent queue, and adds tests to ensure userAMResourceLimit is properly calculated.

This message was automatically generated.

This is a duplicate for YARN-4003, but it is more recent, so using this code.

[~seanpo03] can you please try to do the following:

# the {{inheritParentQueueConfiguration}} should only set capacity for the NO_LABEL case (the only case supported in ReservationSystem for now before YARN-4193 gets in.  Otherwise we risk to have a non-zero max-capacity for a label the plan doesn't even know about... we should prevent this (or set it to zero to prevent abuses/mistakes)
# I like the use of {{inheritParentQueueConfiguration}}... but it should use/subsume the {{updateQuotas(...)}} method, 
as they do similar things (pick values from parent and set them locally).
# can you add in the test something that shows during the init of the patch inherits from parent correctly?

If you do this right away, we can review/commit as we are doing the yarn bugbash live now. (for the next 3h).

Thanks [~curino] for the review. This latest patch uses the CSQueueUtils class to inherit properties from the parent queue. It also adds the ability to whitelist labels for inheritance so that we can select just NO_LABEL to inherit.

[~seanpo03] what you have makes sense to me, but it is mostly overlapping with YARN-4003 (which I close as duplicate of this). What you are missing here, which should be added is the setting (via overriding) of the {{getAMResourceLimit()}} and {{getUserAMResourceLimit()}}. For {{ReservationQueue}} (as we discuss YARN-4003) this limit should be set independently of the local capacity and be set to the value of the parent (as  the reservation capacity will fluctuate heavily, hitting zero at times). Look at the patch i had in YARN-4003 and import in your one similar functionalities. Thanks...

This message was automatically generated.

Thanks [~seanpo03] for working on this. Few comments below.

# in {{setupConfigurableCapacities}} you do null checks on parent. This should never happens right? Is null-check the right behavior?
# do you see any way for us to "harden" our tests more. The bug you are fixing is similar to other changes in {{FairScheduler}} that broke its compatibility with the {{ReservationSystem}}. In that case was due to someone disabling tests (GRRR!!) in this case, I think we simply did not had enough coverage. Do you think we could anything to help prevent this type of issues? (Maybe more end-to-end type tests using Minicluster?)
# use {{assertEquals}} when checking for equalities, instead of {{assertTrue}} (more insightful logs when failing)
# I see you have repaired things for the {{NO_LABEL}} case. We have some pending work for support of node labels in the ReservationSystem, that [~atumanov] was driving. Any chance to adapt this JIRA to start making that easier? (open question, while this is a fast bug-fix so ok to say no).
